shortDescription: Daily journaling practice for self-reflection, emotional processing, and mental clarity
scientificBenefits: Reduced stress and anxiety through emotional processing

researchCitations.study: Pennebaker & Smyth (2016) - Opening Up by Writing It Down
researchCitations.finding: Expressive writing about emotions reduces stress and improves physical health markers

researchCitations.study: Emmons & McCullough (2003) - Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
researchCitations.finding: Gratitude journaling increases happiness by 25% and improves sleep quality

researchCitations.study: Lepore & Smyth (2002) - Journal of Clinical Psychology
researchCitations.finding: Journaling for 15-20 minutes, 3-4 times/week reduces anxiety and depression symptoms

commonBarriers: Don't know what to write about
Evening tiredness makes it feel like a chore
progressionPlan: Week 1-2: 5 minutes daily, simple prompts (3 gratitudes, biggest win/challenge). Week 3-4: 10 minutes, free-form writing. Week 5-8: 10-20 minutes, establish routine (morning reflection or evening review), experiment with formats (bullet journal, stream-of-consciousness).
nooLifeFeatureHighlight: Built-in Journey screen with 4 daily journal cards (mood, tasks, visual, text). Track journaling consistency. GTA-style reflective visuals. Contributes to Wisdom, Confidence, and Focus ratings.
testimonial: "Never journaled before NooLife. The daily prompts made it easy. 48-day streak, it's my mental reset button now." - Priya N.
ctaAngle: Build a daily journaling habit with prompts and tracking. Free 3-day trial.
